Issues.Title: Add new Sass variable to customize .panel-block padding
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**.
This is a **feature** request.

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**.
This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version 1.32.8 of the dart sass npm package.
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**.

### Description

I would like to be able to customize `.panel-block` padding via a Sass variable. The current `panel.sass` source in version `0.9.2` of Bulma allows customization of `.panel-heading` padding via the `$panel-heading-padding` variable. It would be nice to have a similar variable for `.panel-block` elements.

```
// From panel.sass

.panel-heading
  background-color: $panel-heading-background-color
  border-radius: $panel-radius $panel-radius 0 0
  color: $panel-heading-color
  font-size: $panel-heading-size
  font-weight: $panel-heading-weight
  line-height: $panel-heading-line-height
  padding: $panel-heading-padding

...

.panel-block
  align-items: center
  color: $panel-block-color
  display: flex
  justify-content: flex-start
  padding: 0.5em 0.75em
  ...
```

### Steps to Reproduce
N/A

### Expected behavior
I would like to have a `$panel-block-padding` variable that is customizable via Sass.

### Actual behavior
The padding for `.panel-block` elements is hardcoded to `0.5em 0.75em`, and cannot be customized with a Sass variable.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add new Sass variable to customize .panel-block padding" (#3309)

Issues.Title: Suggestion: Define a CSS variable for the current container width (screen width breakpoint)
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about Bulma.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the suggestion

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
<!-- This is about the Bulma **Docs** -->
I'm using Bulma **0.9.2**

### Description

May I suggest a new source code for the container.sass file:

```
@import "../utilities/mixins"

$container-offset: (2 * $gap) !default
$container-max-width: $fullhd !default

.container
  flex-grow: 1
  margin: 0 auto
  position: relative
  width: auto
  &.is-fluid
    max-width: none !important
    padding-left: $gap
    padding-right: $gap
    width: 100%
  +desktop
    max-width: $desktop - $container-offset
    --container-width: #{$desktop - $container-offset}
  +until-widescreen
    &.is-widescreen:not(.is-max-desktop)
      max-width: min($widescreen, $container-max-width) - $container-offset
      --container-width: #{min($widescreen, $container-max-width) - $container-offset}
  +until-fullhd
    &.is-fullhd:not(.is-max-desktop):not(.is-max-widescreen)
      max-width: min($fullhd, $container-max-width) - $container-offset
      --container-width: #{min($fullhd, $container-max-width) - $container-offset}
  +widescreen
    &:not(.is-max-desktop)
      max-width: min($widescreen, $container-max-width) - $container-offset
      --container-width: #{min($widescreen, $container-max-width) - $container-offset}
  +fullhd
    &:not(.is-max-desktop):not(.is-max-widescreen)
      max-width: min($fullhd, $container-max-width) - $container-offset
      --container-width: #{min($fullhd, $container-max-width) - $container-offset}
```

This will set the `--container-width` CSS variable which is very handy when you need to set the height of some things based on the width of the container, for example: `height: calc(100vh - var(--container-width, 100vw) / 3);`.

It will add just a few lines to the code, but will bring a lot of value to Bulma. I'm currently doing it manually in every build where I need it, but it would be nice to have it as a standard feature. Or name it `--containerWidth` if you prefer.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Suggestion: Define a CSS variable for the current container width (screen width breakpoint)" (#3303)

Issues.Body:
### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**.
This is related to #2951.

### Description

- Bulma mentions disabled links in pagination should have a `disabled` attribute added.
- `disabled` is not a valid attribute for the `<a>` tag.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Implement a disabled  [pagination](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/pagination) link by following the documentation (Search for _disabled_ as there is no `id` available).

### Expected behaviour

The Validator shows no error.

### Description
In `utilities`, bulma loads `functions` before `derived-variables`. It uses the variable `$background` in one of the functions (`findLightColor`) AND [calls the function](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/f26b871321a13ff2ce3f6270eec9b9585527d3b7/sass/utilities/derived-variables.sass#L26) in L26 in `derived-variables` before [initializating `$background`](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/f26b871321a13ff2ce3f6270eec9b9585527d3b7/sass/utilities/derived-variables.sass#L52) in L52 in `derived-variables`. This will lead to an error if a variable is not set to a color (which it might in weird edge case).

### Steps to Reproduce
Create `styles.sass`:
```
#{":root"}
  --my-green: rgb(72, 255, 0)
$primary: var(--my-green)
@import './node_modules/bulma/bulma'
```
Run:
```
npm i -S bulma sass
./node_modules/sass styles.scss
```
### Expected behavior
The compilation should pass.

Independent of bulma not supporting non-compile-time-colors, it should still not use variables which are not set yet.

This should be solvable by just rearranging the variables in `derived-variables`.

### Actual behavior
Error message:
```
Error: Undefined variable.
   ╷
91 │   @return $background
   │           ^^^^^^^^^^^
   ╵
  node_modules/bulma/sass/utilities/functions.sass 91:11          findLightColor()
  node_modules/bulma/sass/utilities/derived-variables.sass 26:17  @import
  node_modules/bulma/sass/utilities/_all.sass 6:9                 @import
  node_modules/bulma/bulma.sass 3:9                               @import
  styles.sass 6:9                                                 root stylesheet
```

Issues.Title: Add button modifier / navbar-item modifier that renders button as text, but not underlined
Issues.Body: This is about **Bulma**. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.2] I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**. However, it is somewhat related to #1583. ### Description I want to add a button with an `onClick`-Action as a `navbar-item` to a `navbar-dropdown`. Hence, I want the button to be rendered like my other `navbar-item`s which are `Foo`. According to the documentation [here](https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/button/#colors), there are three modifiers for rendering a button without a border: - `is-white` - `is-text` - `is-ghost` However, `is-text` underlines the text, `is-ghost` colours the text and `is-white` only works for white background. ### Feature request Add a button modifier (or navbar-item modifier???) that renders the button like the other hyperlinks in the `navbar-dropdown` and provides the appropriate hover mouse-cursor (hand with index finger pointing).
